text: Natalia Leonidovna Krachkovskaya (, maiden name - Belogortseva, 24 November 1938 – 3 March 2016) was a Soviet and Russian actress. She was awarded the Meritorious Artist in 1998. She was born in Moscow. She became famous during the 1970s with roles in the movies The Twelve Chairs and Ivan Vasilievich: Back to the Future. Krachkovskaya died on 3 March 2016 in a hospital in Moscow from a heart attack. She was aged 77.Умерла Наталья Крачковская ==References== Category:1938 births Category:2016 deaths Category:Actors from Moscow Category:Deaths from myocardial infarction Category:Russian movie actors Category:Soviet actors
title: Natalia Krachkovskaya
